      • getTile

        public boolean getTile​(TileCacheData tile,
                       long tileRow,
                       long tileColumn,
                       int rset,
                       TileCache.ReadCallback callback)
        Retrieves the specified tile at the specified level from the tile cache. If the tile is not currently cached, it will be derived from existing tiles or read directly from the underlying source.

        One of tile or callback should be specified. When tile is non-null it will be populated with the appropriate data for the tile before the method returns. When callback is non-null, periodic updates will be delivered during execution of the method until all data for the entire tile has been delivered. The methods of the callback will be invoked on the same thread as getTile was invoked on and no reference will be held to callback on any other thread or after the method has returned.

        This method is NOT thread safe and should only be invoked on the thread used to read data directly from the source.

        Parameters:
        tile - Returns the data for the tile to be read; may be null.
        tileRow - The row number of the tile to be read
        tileColumn - The column number of the tile to be read
        rset - The resolution level of the tile to be read
        callback - Provides a callback interface for periodic updates as the data for the tile is read and also allows for an asynchronous abort of the read.
        Returns:
        true if the tile was successfully read, false otherwise. The call will only be unsuccessful if the callback signals cancellation.

      • createTileCacheDatabase
